page.title: 11LOCAL HOUSES
page.content: St. Giles, Dallington, was a toll house until about 1870. In 1835 it cost one penny for 25 sheep to pass.Graylings, Woods Corner, is now an antique shop. It was built in 1740 and used to be the village bake house.The Swan public house is an old coaching inn.It was built in 1399 and before 17th Century it was used by the local justices for courts. The Old Manor,Dallington, dates back to 1380 and is mentioned in Puck of Pooks Hill. Martlets dates back to 17th Century and has a good example of a hip roof, the side view of a catslide roof and hanging tiles of an early pattern. Several houses show that the street was once a thriving shopping area with carpenters shops, post office,Reading Room, Public House.The late Elizabethan Pantons Cottage is a fine example of the use of local
